item.title: proto add a quote by Bill Hicks
item.description: "Today a young man on acid realized that all matter is merely energy condensed to a slow vibration, that we are all one consciousness experiencing itself subjectively, there is no such thing as death, life is only a dream, and we are the imagination of ourselves. Heres Tom with the Weather." -- Bill Hicks

item.title: proto add a quote by John Rogers
item.description:
"There are two novels that can change a bookish fourteen-year old’s life: <i>[book:The Lord of the Rings|10254806]</i> and <i>[book:Atlas Shrugged|9365]</i>. One is a childish fantasy that often engenders a lifelong obsession with its unbelievable heroes, leading to an emotionally stunted, socially crippled adulthood, unable to deal with the real world. The other, of course, involves orcs."
[<i>Kung Fu Monkey -- Ephemera</i>, blog post, March 19, 2009]" -- John Rogers

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "If you are alone you belong entirely to yourself. If you are accompanied by even one companion you belong only half to yourself or even less in proportion to the thoughtlessness of his conduct and if you have more than one companion you will fall more deeply into the same plight." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The painter has the Universe in his mind and hands." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "One can have no smaller or greater mastery than mastery of oneself." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The noblest pleasure is the joy of understanding." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Art is never finished, only abandoned." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Learning never exhausts the mind." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "It is easier to resist at the beginning than at the end." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo DaVinci
item.description: "Iron rusts from disuse, stagnant water loses its purity, and in cold weather becomes frozen; even so does inaction sap the vigors of the mind." -- Leonardo DaVinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "He who thinks little errs much…" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "While I thought that I was learning how to live, I have been learning how to die." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "A poet knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo Da Vinci
item.description: "I have offended God and mankind because my work didn't reach the quality it should have." -- Leonardo Da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo Da Vinci
item.description: "All our knowledge has its origin in our perceptions" -- Leonardo Da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Our life is made by the death of others." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "While human ingenuity may devise various inventions to the same ends, it will never devise anything more beautiful, nor more simple, nor more to the purpose than nature does, because in her inventions nothing is lacking and nothing is superfluous." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes; so with present time." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo Da Vinci
item.description: "Realize that everything connects to everything else." -- Leonardo Da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Anyone who conducts an argument by appealing to authority is not using his intelligence; he is just using his memory." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The painter will produce pictures of little merit if he takes the works of others as his standard." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "We must doubt the certainty of everything which passes through the senses, but how much more ought we to doubt things contrary to the senses, such as the existence of God and the soul." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Men of lofty genius when they are doing the least work are most active." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Why does the eye see more clearly when asleep than the imagination when awake?" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "He is a poor pupil who does not go beyond his master." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: proto add a quote by Ninon de l'Enclos
item.description: "If a man needs a religion to conduct himself properly in this world, it is a sign that he has either a limited mind or a corrupt heart." -- Ninon de l'Enclos

item.title: proto add a quote by Penn Jillette
item.description: "Every time something really bad happens, people cry out for safety, and the government answers by taking rights away from good people. We have no proof that the bad, stupid crazy people who have planted bombs in the past few years used the phone much for their stupid bad crimes, let alone logged on the Internet. Yet when those kind of bad things happen nowadays, the government tries to do bad things to phones and the Net. The phones and the Internet are just good smart things, and the government should leave them alone. You have to watch the government all the time on everything. Thomas Jefferson didn't say that, but he said something very close to that." -- Penn Jillette
